member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.FndXGantt.FndXGantt.Init(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
This method will initialize XGantt object with i.e. GUI settings, zoom depending on screen resolution and other initialization data. It's possible to use the method ChangeInit if you need to change these settings.
Note: Byy using this overload of the Init method the XGantt table headings will not be automatically translated.
This method should be called when: - A new form is loaded - After the XGantt object has been called by the method "Clear".
member.param: The current view there the data should be fetched from.
This parameter will specify the column name of the Start Date column that is used for the Start Date of a Node in the XGantt.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.FndXGantt.FndXGantt.Init(System.String,PPJ.Runtime.SalWindowHandle,System.String)
member.summary:
This method will initialize XGantt object with i.e. GUI settings, zoom depending on screen resolution and other initialization data. It's possible to use the method ChangeInit if you need to change these settings.
This method should be called when: - A new form is loaded - After the XGantt object has been called by the method "Clear".
member.param: The current view there the data should be fetched from.
The dummy table that is used only for the Query dialog in the window and translating XGantt table columns. This must be a fully qualified reference!
This parameter will specify the column name of the Start Date column that is used for the Start Date of a Node in the XGantt.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.FndXGantt.FndXGantt.ChangeInit(System.String,PPJ.Runtime.SalWindowHandle,System.String)
member.summary:
This method will change the initialize XGantt object settings with i.e. GUI settings, zoom depending on screen resolution and other initialization data. The Init method should be called before this method could be used
This method should be called when: - When for instance the XGantt should load data from a different view after Init has been executed
member.param: The current view there the data should be fetched from.
he dummy table that is used only for the Query dialog in the window. This must be a fully qualified reference!
This parameter will specify the column name of the Start Date column that is used for the Start Date of a Node in the XGantt.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.FndXGantt.FndXGantt.AddDynamicCalendar(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method will make it possible to have a dynamic period in the calendar. The Calendar period will be dependent on the what date the first and last node that is being load will have.
member.param: This parameter will specify the column name of the End Date column that is used for the End Date of a Node in the XGantt.

This parameter will give you the opportunity to add an extra time interval before and after the date of the first and last node that has been loaded. The unit is day. If you enter XGANTT_DATES in this parameter the current XGantt calendar date will be used.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.FndXGantt.FndXGantt.InsertNode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function will insert a node record into XGantt object. This is a wrapping of the XGantt method InsertNodeRecord, with some extra functionality. It's necessary to perform a EndLoading method to be able to see a new node, but if you are inserting several records only the last record needs to have the EndLoading method. For performance reasons only the last inserted record should have a EndLoading.
member.param: The data to insert in a record should have concatenated string of the attributes.
This parameter will perform the EndLoading method if it's set to TRUE.
member.returns: Returns true if the insert was ok.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.FndXGantt.FndXGantt.InsertNode(System.String,System.Boolean,NETRONIC.XGantt.VcNode@)
member.summary: This function will insert a node record into XGantt object. This is a wrapping of the XGantt method InsertNodeRecord, with some extra functionality. It's necessary to perform a EndLoading method to be able to see a new node, but if you are inserting several records only the last record needs to have the EndLoading method. For performance reasons only the last inserted record should have a EndLoading.
member.param: The data to insert in a record should have concatenated string of the attributes.
This parameter will perform the EndLoading method if it's set to TRUE.
The node inserted in XGantt
member.returns: Returns true if the insert was ok.

member.summary: This function will insert a node record into XGantt object. This is a wrapping of the XGantt method InsertNodeRecord, with some extra functionality. member.summary: This function will insert a link or relation record into XGantt object. This is a wrapping of the XGantt method InsertLinkRecord, with some extra functionality. It's necessary to perform a EndLoading method to be able to see a new node, but if you are inserting several records only the last record needs to have the EndLoading method. For performance reasons only the last inserted record should have a EndLoading.

This parameter will perform the EndLoading method if it's set to TRUE.
member.returns: Returns true if the insert was ok.
